result.execSummary:
The defendant Miguel A Hernandez Otero was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Operate with Restricted Controlled Substance (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(am).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

for Fine/costs - $150 bi-weekly
Blessinger hearing held

This a Blessinger Hearing for a Committment Warrant that was issued for failure to pay fines, fees, or costs that were previously ordered by the Court.  
Court Case(s) #: 15CM92

Defendant appears by video from the jail.

Court questions the Defendant as to his/her reasons for failing to pay and his/her financial status.
Court informs the Defendant that serving time in jail will not reduce or eliminate the fine.

Defendant is employed at Oakwood Exteriors.

BY THE COURT:  Defendant to serve jail time as reflected on the Commitment Warrant in the file of 37 days or in lieu of;
Defendant must pay $ 500.00 to be released from jail and set up wage assignment with a payment plan at  $150.00 to be withheld from his payroll bi-weekly.
Defendant must appear in the Clerk of Courts Office to sign the wage assignment and establish the monthly payment plan.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Miguel A Hernandez Otero in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CM92, 14CT172 and 14CT148.

9:37 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Court takes a moment to review the elements provided by the Attorney for the defendant.
Court prints jury instructions and reviews and allows Attorney for defendant to reveiw and go over with his client.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CM92:
Count 1 - No contest 
Count 2 - DRI
Count 3 - No contest 

14CT172:
Count 1 - DRI

14CT148:
Count 1 - No contest 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count  1 & 3 of 15CM92 and Count 2 is DRI; guilty on Count 1 of 14CT148 and Count 1 of 14CT172 is DRI.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
15CM92:
Count 1 -
Impose 10 days in county jail with Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department for work, counseling and any other reason the sheriff will allow.
Second half of sentence can be completed on home monitor as approved by the jail/risk assessment. 
Sentence to commence within 60 days. 
Must report today for start date.
Pay fine of $400 plus costs totalling $1,442.00
Pay blood draw fee of $26.45
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.
13 month DL revocation
13 month IID on any vehicles owned, operated or titled in his name
Complete an Alcohol/Drug Assessment or Department of Transportation Driver Safety Plan and comply with any recommendations.
Assessment needs to be completed in Wood County for the DOT assessment.
2 days of jail credit granted.

Count 2 - DRI

Count 3 -
Pay fine of $200 plus costs.
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

14CT172:
Count 1 - DRI

14CT148:
Count 1 -
Pay $100 fine plus costs
Zero days jail
Zero days suspension 
Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

Wage assignment set

$300.00 cash bond covers 14CT148, 14CT172, and 15CM92: Defendant to sign a Wage assignment to be released from jail and pay $75 per paycheck.   Do not operate Motor Vehicle without a valid Drivers License.

1:20 p.m. Defendant Miguel A Hernandez Otero appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty Louis J. Molepske appeared for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Cases 15CM92, 14CT148, and 14CT172.  BTC: Warrants are quashed. Court ask the Defendant his reasons for missing court prior.  Defendant states reasons for missing court. State requests cash bonds for each case.
Atty Drengler requests sig bond. Defendant gets paid every two weeks.

BTC: $300.00 cash bond covers 14CT148, 14CT172, and 15CM92: Defendant to sign a Wage assignment to be released from jail and pay $75 per paycheck. (moneys to be receipted to 15CM92).

Attorney Ryan Drengler in court. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 15CM-92, 14CT-172 and 14CT-148.

9:47 AM Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Atty Drengler addresses the Court, does not know where his client is, is surprised.

State requests warrants.

Atty Drengler requests cash alternatives and requests the Court to hold off on forfeiting bond amount.

Court addresses the parties.

BY THE COURT:
15CM-92:  Court orders a bench warrant for arrest, no cash alternative. Bond is forfeited.
14CT-172: Court orders a bench warrant for arrest, no cash alternative. Bond is forfeited.
14CT-148: Court orders a bench warrant for arrest, no cash alternative. Bond is forfeited.
